gw.api.community

Class PublicGroupFinder

  • gw.api.community.PublicGroupFinder

  • public class PublicGroupFinder
    Provides methods for finding Groups.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Group findByPublicId(String publicId)
      IQueryBeanResult<Bean> findLoadFactorGroupsByUser(User user)
      Finds only the load factor groups that the user belongs to.
      Group findRootGroup(User user)
      This method picks one of the groups that the user belongs to, and then follows the group parent links up to find the root group. Although users may belong to multiple groups, this method assumes that every user belongs to exactly one root group (so it doesn't matter which group we start with in going up the tree). There is a special case for when a user doesn't belong to any groups at all--for example, "System User" or unassigned users. In that case the root group for the insurer itself is currently returned, but I'm not sure if that's the right thing to do.

      • findRootGroup

        Group findRootGroup(User user)
        This method picks one of the groups that the user belongs to, and then follows the group parent links up to find the root group. Although users may belong to multiple groups, this method assumes that every user belongs to exactly one root group (so it doesn't matter which group we start with in going up the tree). There is a special case for when a user doesn't belong to any groups at all--for example, "System User" or unassigned users. In that case the root group for the insurer itself is currently returned, but I'm not sure if that's the right thing to do.
        Parameters:
        user - the user to find the root group for.
        Returns:
        The root group that the user belongs to.
